25 #ifndef __BITPIT_PABLO_MORTON_HPP__
26 #define __BITPIT_PABLO_MORTON_HPP__
27 
28 #include <cstdint>
29 #include <limits>
30 
31 namespace bitpit {
32 
33 namespace PABLO {
34 
35 const uint64_t INVALID_MORTON = std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max();
36 
45 inline uint64_t splitBy3(uint32_t a)
46 {
47  uint64_t x = a & 0x1fffff; // we only look at the first 21 bits
48  x = (x | x << 32) & 0x1f00000000ffff; // shift left 32 bits, OR with self, and 00011111000000000000000000000000000000001111111111111111
49  x = (x | x << 16) & 0x1f0000ff0000ff; // shift left 32 bits, OR with self, and 00011111000000000000000011111111000000000000000011111111
50  x = (x | x << 8) & 0x100f00f00f00f00f; // shift left 32 bits, OR with self, and 0001000000001111000000001111000000001111000000001111000000000000
51  x = (x | x << 4) & 0x10c30c30c30c30c3; // shift left 32 bits, OR with self, and 0001000011000011000011000011000011000011000011000011000100000000
52  x = (x | x << 2) & 0x1249249249249249;
53 
54  return x;
55 }
56 
65 inline uint64_t splitBy2(uint32_t a)
66 {
67  uint64_t x = a;
68  x = (x | x << 16) & 0xFFFF0000FFFF; // shift left 16 bits, OR with self, and 0000000000000000111111111111111100000000000000001111111111111111
69  x = (x | x << 8) & 0xFF00FF00FF00FF; // shift left 8 bits, OR with self, and 0000000011111111000000001111111100000000111111110000000011111111
70  x = (x | x << 4) & 0xF0F0F0F0F0F0F0F; // shift left 4 bits, OR with self, and 0000111100001111000011110000111100001111000011110000111100001111
71  x = (x | x << 2) & 0x3333333333333333; // shift left 2 bits, OR with self, and 0011001100110011001100110011001100110011001100110011001100110011
72  x = (x | x << 1) & 0x5555555555555555; // shift left 1 bits, OR with self, and 0101010101010101010101010101010101010101010101010101010101010101
73 
74  return x;
75 }
76 
88 inline uint64_t computeMorton(uint32_t x, uint32_t y, uint32_t z)
89 {
90  uint64_t morton = splitBy3(x) | splitBy3(y) << 1 | splitBy3(z) << 2;
91 
92  return morton;
93 }
94 
105 inline uint64_t computeMorton(uint32_t x, uint32_t y)
106 {
107  uint64_t morton = splitBy2(x) | splitBy2(y) << 1;
108 
109  return morton;
110 }
111 
121 inline uint64_t computeXYZKey(uint64_t x, uint64_t y, uint64_t z, int8_t maxLevel)
122 {
123  uint64_t key = x | (y << (maxLevel+1)) | (z << 2*(maxLevel+1));
124 
125  return key;
126 }
127 
136 inline uint64_t computeXYZKey(uint64_t x, uint64_t y, int8_t maxLevel)
137 {
138  uint64_t key = x | (y << (maxLevel+1));
139 
140  return key;
141 }
142 
143 }
